means: 不再抱幻想的，不再着迷的，感到幻灭的
使不再着迷(disenchant的过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: I'm disenchanted with the state of British theatre at the moment.
sentence.Network_cn: 我对英国戏剧当下的状况不再抱有幻想。

sentence.Network_en: He was becoming disenchanted with his job as a lawyer.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对自己的律师工作渐渐地不抱幻想了。

sentence.Network_en: Nevertheless, she is always optimistic about the possibilities and can work her charm on the disenchanted.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然如此，她总是乐观地抱持希望，并能深深地感染那些心灰意冷的人。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(D) ... disenchant 使清醒 disenchanted 不再着迷的 disenchanting 使不再着迷的.
sat s.c. mistakes words1 flashcards | Quizlet ... nonplus 使困惑 disenchanted 不再抱幻想的 voluptuous 激起性欲的.
反乌托邦思想认为，在这样“除魅”（disenchanted）的机械化世界里，一切先前抚慰人心特质—特别是精神意义已不复存在。科学技术 …

more and more people are inclined towards the Liberal Party as they become disenchanted with the two main parties that have governed the country for half a century .人们对统治这个国家达半个世纪之久的两大政党不再抱有幻想，愈来愈多的人倾向于自由党。

list.abs: I ' m increasingly disenchanted with my current job ., 我对目前的工作越来越不满意了.
I just disenchanted one into a nexus ., 我刚刚才把一个拆成连结水晶.
But I did become progressively disenchanted , because further and further away from the character ., 但我的表演变得越来越缺乏吸引力 , 因为离角色越来越远了.

RelatedPhrase.word: quite disenchanted with the Tory Government

list.key: quite disenchanted with the Tory Government
list.exp: 保守党政府不再抱有幻想
list.abs: He is quite disenchanted with the Tory Government ., 他对保守党政府不再抱有幻想.

entry.tran: 不再着迷的;不再抱有幻想的;感到幻灭的
entry.def: If you are disenchanted with something, you are disappointed with it and no longer believe that it is good or worthwhile.

example.ex: I'm disenchanted with the state of British theatre at the moment.
example.tran: 我对英国戏剧当下的状况不再抱有幻想。

auth_sentence.content: Ms. Kennedy said moments like those disenchanted her with government.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ms. Kennedy said moments like those disenchanted her with government.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ms. Kennedy said moments like those disenchanted her with government.

auth_sentence.content: Upon his arrival, Paul Lambert inherited a disenchanted support.
auth_sentence.res_content: Upon his arrival, Paul Lambert inherited a disenchanted support.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Upon his arrival, Paul Lambert inherited a disenchanted support.

auth_sentence.content: There, she tried real estate, but soon was disenchanted.
auth_sentence.res_content: There, she tried real estate, but soon was disenchanted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There, she tried real estate, but soon was disenchanted.

means.word_mean: 不再抱幻想的,不再着迷的,感到幻灭的

sentences.en: If something could disenchant voters, it would be the image of a political leader who is relying on an omnipotent image to woo votes.
sentences.cn: 一个依赖以往的成绩和无所不能的形象来争取选票的政治领导人，只会使选民感到失望。

sentences.en: More and more people are inclined towards the Liberal Party as they become disenchanted with the two main parties that have governed the country for half a century.
sentences.cn: 人们对统治这个国家达半个世纪之久的两大政党不再抱有幻想，愈来愈多的人倾向于自由党。
